_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: KitsuneLab CS2 Egg @ K4ryuu
author: contact@kitsune-lab.com
description: The SteamRT3 Platform image for Pterodactyl CS2 servers is packed with numerous features, designed to simplify server management and reduce hassle.

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
# steamcmd Base Installation Script
#
# Server Files: /mnt/server
## just in case someone removed the defaults.
if [ "${STEAM_USER}" == "" ]; then
STEAM_USER=anonymous
STEAM_PASS=""
STEAM_AUTH=""
fi
## download and install steamcmd
cd /tmp
mkdir -p /mnt/server/steamcmd
curl -sSL -o steamcmd.tar.gz https://steamcdn-a.akamaihd.net/client/installer/steamcmd_linux.tar.gz
tar -xzvf steamcmd.tar.gz -C /mnt/server/steamcmd
mkdir -p /mnt/server/steamapps # Fix steamcmd disk write error when this folder is missing
cd /mnt/server/steamcmd
# SteamCMD fails otherwise for some reason, even running as root.
# This is changed at the end of the install process anyways.
chown -R root:root /mnt
export HOME=/mnt/server
## install game using steamcmd
./steamcmd.sh +force_install_dir /mnt/server +login ${STEAM_USER} ${STEAM_PASS} ${STEAM_AUTH} +app_update ${SRCDS_APPID} ${EXTRA_FLAGS} +quit ## other flags may be needed depending on install. looking at you cs 1.6
## set up 32 bit libraries
mkdir -p /mnt/server/.steam/sdk32
cp -v linux32/steamclient.so ../.steam/sdk32/steamclient.so
## set up 64 bit libraries
mkdir -p /mnt/server/.steam/sdk64
cp -v linux64/steamclient.so ../.steam/sdk64/steamclient.so

variables.name: Map
variables.description: The default map for the server.

variables.name: Source AppID
variables.description: NOT VISIBLE TO USERS. DO NOT EDIT.

variables.name: Max Players
variables.description: The maximum number of players the server can host.

variables.name: Disable Updates
variables.description: Set to 1 to stop updates.

variables.name: Validate Install
variables.description: Toggles SteamCMD validation of game server files. Set to 0 to disable.

variables.name: Game Server Login Token (GSLT)
variables.description: The Steam Account Token required for the server to be displayed publicly. https://steamcommunity.com/dev/managegameservers

variables.name: Junk Cleaner - Enabled
variables.description: Cleans up automatically logs after 72 hour, demo files after 7 days and round backup files after 24 hour.

variables.name: Auto Update - CounterStrikeSharp
variables.description: Enable or disable the automatic update of CSS on every server startup.

variables.name: Auto Update - MetaMod
variables.description: Enable or disable the automatic update of MetaMod on every server startup.

variables.name: Filter - Enabled
variables.description: Enable or disable the console filter to hide specific messages. Configure it using the file at '/game/mute_messages.cfg' when enabled.

variables.name: Filter - Preview Mode
variables.description: Enable or disable preview mode for the console filter. In preview mode, blocked messages are shown in red, allowing you to verify your filter configuration.

variables.name: Custom Parameters
variables.description: Custom startup parameters to add to the command line.

variables.name: Auto Restart - Enabled
variables.description: Enable or disable the automatic server restart when a new game version is detected.

variables.name: Auto Restart - Check Interval
variables.description:
The update detection interval, in seconds, for automatic restarts.
Please note that excessive usage may trigger Steam's rate limiting.

variables.name: Auto Restart - API URL
variables.description:
The panel URL used for API calls.
This should remain hidden from users. Update the default value to ensure all new servers use this setting.

variables.name: Auto Restart - User API key
variables.description:
Your personal API key to this panel. You can generate a new one at "API Credentials".
Do not add a default value here from an admin, if you host other people's server as it can be extracted from the docker environment. Let your users create their own.

variables.name: Auto Restart - Commands
variables.description: JSON structure for configuring update countdown notifications or executing specific commands at defined countdown intervals.
variables.default_value: {"300": "say Attention: The server will update in 5 minutes. Please prepare to save your progress.", "60": "say Heads up: The server will update in 1 minute. Save your progress now.", "30": "say Warning: The server update is happening in 30 seconds. Get ready!", "10": "say Final notice: The server will update in 10 seconds. Please stand by.", "3": "say Final countdown: Update in 3 seconds. Hold tight!", "2": "say Final countdown: Update in 2 seconds. Almost there!", "1": "say Final countdown: Update in 1 second. Restarting now!"}

variables.name: Auto Restart - Countdown Interval
variables.description: The time interval for the countdown in seconds before the restart.

variables.name: Auto Restart - Steam API Key
variables.description: Your personal Steam API key to check for updates. You can generate a new one at https://steamcommunity.com/dev/apikey.

variables.name: Auto Restart - Discord Webhook
variables.description: Discord webhook URL to send notifications when the server is scheduled to update automatically. This sends a cool embed with details such as the patch date and countdown timer.

variables.name: Egg - File Logging
variables.description: Log Egg messages to /egg.log, which is stored for 48 hours.

variables.name: Egg - Log Level
variables.description: The log level for the Egg to show in the console and log file.
